      • protocolFlagMatches

        protected boolean protocolFlagMatches(org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.protocol.SeProtocol protocolFlag)
                               throws org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException
        Tells if the current SE protocol matches the provided protocol flag. If the protocol flag is not defined (null), we consider here that it matches. An exception is returned when the provided protocolFlag is not found in the current protocolMap.
        Specified by:
        protocolFlagMatches in class org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.plugin.AbstractLocalReader
        Parameters:
        protocolFlag - the protocol flag
        Returns:
        true if the current SE matches the protocol flag
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException - if the protocol mask is not found

      • setParameter

        public void setParameter(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String value)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleBaseException
        Set a parameter.

        These are the parameters you can use with their associated values:

        • protocol:
          • Tx: Automatic negotiation (default)
          • T0: T0 protocol
          • T1: T1 protocol
        • mode:
          • shared: Shared between apps and threads (default)
          • exclusive: Exclusive to this app and the current thread
        • disconnect:
          • reset: Reset the card
          • unpower: Simply unpower it
          • leave: Unsupported
          • eject: Eject
        • thread_wait_timeout: Number of milliseconds to wait
        Parameters:
        name - Parameter name
        value - Parameter value
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleBaseException - This method can fail when disabling the exclusive mode as it's executed instantly
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when parameter is wrong

      • getParameters

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getParameters()

        Returns:

      • openPhysicalChannel

        protected void openPhysicalChannel()
                            throws org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleChannelStateException
        Opens a physical channel The card access may be set to 'Exclusive' through the reader's settings. In this case be aware that on some platforms (ex. Windows 8+), the exclusivity is granted for a limited time (ex. 5 seconds). After this delay, the card is automatically resetted.
        Specified by:
        openPhysicalChannel in class org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.plugin.AbstractSelectionLocalReader
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleChannelStateException - if a reader error occurs
